page.title: 17Flowers in the Hexton Area
page.content:
Hexton is on the {North East}edge of the {Chiltern Hills }and the soil is very chalky. In May and June yellow cowslips and dandelions are the most common flowers and we also found hawthorn, bugloss, violets, buttercups, celandines and cow parsley. Cowslips are rare flowers and like chalky soil. That is why there are lots growing in the Hexton Chalk Pit.
The{Chalk Pit}is a{Nature Reserve}and the flowers there are specially protected so they will not become extinct. In the summer the very rare {Pyramid}and{Bee Orchids }also grow there.
We found many flowers when we were exploring our area.
